metadata.name: SSI Federal Eligibility Rules (2024)
metadata.description: Federal SSI (Supplemental Security Income) eligibility rules for 2024. SSI provides monthly cash assistance to disabled, blind, or elderly individuals with limited income and resources.

rules.name: SSI Age Eligibility
rules.description: Must be 65 or older, OR blind, OR disabled

explanation.qualified: You meet the age, blindness, or disability requirement for SSI.
explanation.notQualified: You must be 65 or older, blind, or have a qualifying disability to be eligible for SSI.

rules.name: SSI Income Eligibility
rules.description: Must have limited income (varies by state and living situation)

explanation.qualified: Your income is within SSI limits.
explanation.notQualified: Your income exceeds SSI limits. The maximum monthly income is $943 for individuals and $1,415 for couples in 2024.

rules.name: SSI Asset Eligibility
rules.description: Must have limited resources (under $2,000 for individuals, $3,000 for couples)

explanation.qualified: Your assets are within SSI limits.
explanation.notQualified: Your assets exceed SSI limits. The maximum resources are $2,000 for individuals and $3,000 for couples in 2024.

rules.name: SSI Citizenship Eligibility
rules.description: Must be a U.S. citizen or qualified immigrant

explanation.qualified: You meet the citizenship or immigration status requirement for SSI.
explanation.notQualified: You must be a U.S. citizen or qualified immigrant to be eligible for SSI.

rules.name: SSI Residence Eligibility
rules.description: Must live in the United States or Northern Mariana Islands

explanation.qualified: You meet the residence requirement for SSI.
explanation.notQualified: You must live in the United States or Northern Mariana Islands to be eligible for SSI.

rules.name: SSI Disability Eligibility
rules.description: Must have a qualifying disability (if under 65 and not blind)

explanation.qualified: You meet the disability requirement for SSI.
explanation.notQualified: If you are under 65 and not blind, you must have a qualifying disability that prevents you from working to be eligible for SSI.

requiredDocuments.name: Medical Records
requiredDocuments.description: Documentation of disability or medical condition

requiredDocuments.name: Financial Statements
requiredDocuments.description: Bank statements, pay stubs, and other financial documents

requiredDocuments.name: Proof of Residence
requiredDocuments.description: Utility bills, lease agreement, or other proof of address

nextSteps.description: Call 1-800-772-1213 or visit ssa.gov to start your application

nextSteps.title: Gather Required Documents
nextSteps.description: Collect all necessary documents including birth certificate, medical records, and financial statements

nextSteps.title: Schedule Appointment
nextSteps.description: Make an appointment at your local Social Security office

nextSteps.title: Complete Application
nextSteps.description: Fill out the SSI application with a Social Security representative

nextSteps.title: Wait for Decision
nextSteps.description: Wait for Social Security to make a decision (usually 3-5 months)
